p: The epidemic of influenza is an important public health problem in worldwide [ 1]. Influenza virus genera A (Flu A) or B (Flu B) infections account for a vast majority of influenza cases in humans [ 2]. Most of these infections are asymptomatic or exhibit relatively mild symptoms, presenting as influenza-like illnesses (ILI). However, some patients with influenza exhibit severe symptoms, leading to hospitalization or even death, particularly in children, the elderly, and those with underlying chronic conditions [ 3]. Seasonal influenza results in approximately 250,000â€“500,000 deaths worldwide in each year [ 4].
